alert.note: Alert for Mobile (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 30 at 12:41PM CST until December 30 at 1:30PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Alabama, including the following counties, Baldwin and Mobile. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1240 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Daphne, Fairhope, Gulf Shores, Bay Minette, Foley, Orange Beach, Spanish Fort, Robertsdale, Point Clear, Loxley, Stockton, Magnolia Springs, Stapleton, Bon Secour, Summerdale, Silverhill, Elberta, I65 And AL 225, Fort Morgan and Steelwood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
